AVR micro-optimization: Avr-gcc and --short-enums
/post/2019-01-28-avr-gcc-short-enums/ 2019-01-28T00:00:00+0000 2019-01-28T00:00:00+0000 How big is an enum? I noticed something odd while browsing through the assembly output of some AVR C code I wrote recently. In the code, I have the following expression: int main() { setup(); while (state != STATE_QUIT) { loop(); } } Here, state is a variable of type enum STATE, which looks something like this (not exactly like this; there are actually 19 possible values but I didn’t want to clutter this post with unnecessary code listings):
